page.title: 11FARMING IN SUFFOLK
page.content: My husband farms 12,000 acres, 635 at Chevington, a village 7 miles from Bury St. Edmunds, this land belongs to the Bristol Estate and the National Trust; he also farm 560 acres 5 miles away in Barrow, 430 acres owned by Miss MacRae, a member of the Bristol family, and 130 acres owned by my husband's family. He grows wheat, barley, sugar beet and oil seed rape. We also have 1800 pigs, which are reared for J. Sainsbury PLC on a bacon contract. In Chevington we also own an additional 25 acres with buildings for the pigs. We own 4 houses for men working on the farms. Each farm employs 7 men on a full-time basis with extra labour at harvest time.
